description: Starts a batch job and returns the unique identifier of this execution of the batch job. The associated application must be running in order to start the batch job.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the application associated with this batch job.

parameters.name: batchJobIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the batch job. fileBatchJobIdentifier (dict) --- Specifies a file associated with a specific batch job. The file name for the batch job identifier. folderPath (string) --- The relative path to the file name for the batch job identifier. restartBatchJobIdentifier (dict) --- Specifies the required information for restart, including executionId and JobStepRestartMarker. The executionId from the StartBatchJob response when the job ran for the first time. The step/procedure step information for a restart batch job operation. fromProcStep (string) --- The procedure step name that a batch job was restarted from. The step name that a batch job was restarted from. skip (boolean) --- The step-level checkpoint timestamp (creation or last modification) for an Amazon Web Services Blu Age application batch job. stepCheckpoint (integer) --- Skip selected step and issue a restart from immediate successor step for an Amazon Web Services Blu Age application batch job. toProcStep (string) --- The procedure step name that a batch job was restarted to. toStep (string) --- The step name that a batch job was restarted to. s3BatchJobIdentifier (dict) --- Specifies an Amazon S3 location that identifies the batch jobs that you want to run. Use this identifier to run ad hoc batch jobs. The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the batch job definitions. Identifies the batch job definition. This identifier can also point to any batch job definition that already exists in the application or to one of the batch job definitions within the directory that is specified in keyPrefix. fileName (string) --- The name of the file that contains the batch job definition. scriptName (string) --- The name of the script that contains the batch job definition. keyPrefix (string) --- The key prefix that specifies the path to the folder in the S3 bucket that has the batch job definitions. scriptBatchJobIdentifier (dict) --- A batch job identifier in which the batch job to run is identified by the script name. The name of the script containing the batch job definition.

nested_params.name: fileBatchJobIdentifier
nested_params.description: Specifies a file associated with a specific batch job.

nested_params.name: fileName
nested_params.description: The file name for the batch job identifier.

nested_params.name: folderPath
nested_params.description: The relative path to the file name for the batch job identifier.

nested_params.name: restartBatchJobIdentifier
nested_params.description: Specifies the required information for restart, including executionId and JobStepRestartMarker.

nested_params.name: executionId
nested_params.description: The executionId from the StartBatchJob response when the job ran for the first time.

nested_params.name: jobStepRestartMarker
nested_params.description: The step/procedure step information for a restart batch job operation.

nested_params.name: fromProcStep
nested_params.description: The procedure step name that a batch job was restarted from.

nested_params.name: fromStep
nested_params.description: The step name that a batch job was restarted from.

nested_params.name: skip
nested_params.description: The step-level checkpoint timestamp (creation or last modification) for an Amazon Web Services Blu Age application batch job.

nested_params.name: stepCheckpoint
nested_params.description: Skip selected step and issue a restart from immediate successor step for an Amazon Web Services Blu Age application batch job.

nested_params.name: toProcStep
nested_params.description: The procedure step name that a batch job was restarted to.

nested_params.name: toStep
nested_params.description: The step name that a batch job was restarted to.

nested_params.name: s3BatchJobIdentifier
nested_params.description: Specifies an Amazon S3 location that identifies the batch jobs that you want to run. Use this identifier to run ad hoc batch jobs.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the batch job definitions.

nested_params.name: identifier
nested_params.description: Identifies the batch job definition. This identifier can also point to any batch job definition that already exists in the application or to one of the batch job definitions within the directory that is specified in keyPrefix.

nested_params.name: fileName
nested_params.description: The name of the file that contains the batch job definition.

nested_params.name: scriptName
nested_params.description: The name of the script that contains the batch job definition.

nested_params.name: keyPrefix
nested_params.description: The key prefix that specifies the path to the folder in the S3 bucket that has the batch job definitions.

nested_params.name: scriptBatchJobIdentifier
nested_params.description: A batch job identifier in which the batch job to run is identified by the script name.

nested_params.name: scriptName
nested_params.description: The name of the script containing the batch job definition.

parameters.name: jobParams
parameters.description: The collection of batch job parameters. For details about limits for keys and values, see Coding variables in JCL. (string) --- See https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/workload-automation/9.3.0?topic=zos-coding-variables-in-jcl to get details about limits for both keys and values: 8 for keys (variable names), 44 for values (variable values) In addition, keys will be only alphabetic characters and digits, without any space or special characters (dash, underscore, etc --¦) For BluAge Engine: There is no limit in length of keys and values. Additional validation may be applied in code, per engine. Parameter key: the first character must be alphabetic. Can be of up to 32 alphanumeric characters. (string) --- Parameter value can be of up to 1024 alphanumeric characters.

nested_items.name: executionId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of this execution of the batch job.
